tasks.title: Environment Setup and Pre-Migration Backup
tasks.description: Initialize the distribution and archive directories and perform a full backup of all source materials to prevent data loss.
tasks.details:
1. Create directory `dist/` for final outputs.
2. Create directory `dist/images/` and `dist/images/ko/` for assets.
3. Create directory `archive/`.
4. Copy `docs/`, `legacy/`, `staging/`, `templates/`, and root Markdown files (`University_Copilot_Guide_for_Beginners.md`, `University_Copilot_Guide_Admin.md`) into `archive/` preserving the structure.
5. Verify file counts and sizes match between source and archive.
tasks.testStrategy: Run a script to compare checksums (MD5/SHA) of files in source directories vs. `archive/` to ensure exact duplication.

subtasks.title: Initialize Distribution Directory Structure
subtasks.description: Create the output directory hierarchy for the final build artifacts.
subtasks.details: Create the `dist/` root directory. Inside it, create `dist/images/` and `dist/images/ko/` to house English and Korean image assets respectively, ensuring the target environment is ready for content generation.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify directories exist using `ls -d dist/images/ko`.

subtasks.title: Initialize Archive Directory
subtasks.description: Create the dedicated archive folder to store the pre-migration backup.
subtasks.details: Create the `archive/` directory at the project root. This will serve as the destination for the raw copy of all source materials before any consolidation scripts are run.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify `archive/` directory exists.

subtasks.title: Backup Source Directories
subtasks.description: recursively copy all source content folders into the archive directory.
subtasks.details: Copy the directories `docs/`, `legacy/`, `staging/`, and `templates/` into `archive/`. Ensure that file metadata and directory structures are preserved recursively (e.g., using `cp -r` or similar).
subtasks.testStrategy: Check that `archive/docs`, `archive/legacy`, etc. exist and contain files.

subtasks.title: Backup Root Documentation Files
subtasks.description: Copy essential root-level Markdown documentation files to the archive.
subtasks.details: Copy `University_Copilot_Guide_for_Beginners.md` and `University_Copilot_Guide_Admin.md` from the project root into `archive/`. These are critical source inputs for the consolidation process.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the specific markdown files exist inside the `archive/` folder.

subtasks.title: Verify Backup Integrity
subtasks.description: Validate that the archived files match the source files in count and size.
subtasks.details: Run a verification step (e.g., using `diff -r` or comparing file counts/checksums) to ensure that the contents of `archive/` are identical to the source locations (`docs/`, `legacy/`, etc.). Report any discrepancies.
subtasks.testStrategy: Execute a checksum comparison script or command line diff; expect zero output or specific success message.

tasks.title: Content Inventory and Source Mapping
tasks.description: Analyze all source files to map specific sections to the final document structure defined in the PRD.
tasks.details:
1. Scan `docs/en/` and `docs/ko/` for Level 1-3 content.
2. Scan `staging/refined_content.md` for updates to Level 1-3 content.
3. Scan `legacy/` for unique Admin workflows not present in `docs/`.
4. Scan `templates/exercises/` for workbook content.
5. Create a JSON or Markdown map file (`content_map.json`) defining the source path for each section of the final `University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_*.md` structure (Introduction, Basics, Practical, Advanced, Admin, Appendix).
tasks.testStrategy: Manual review of `content_map.json` against PRD Section 3.2 to ensure every target section has a defined source.

subtasks.title: Inventory Core Documentation Structure
subtasks.description: Analyze the primary documentation directories to establish the base content structure against the PRD sections.
subtasks.details: Recursively scan `docs/en/` and `docs/ko/` directories. Identify file paths corresponding to Introduction, Basics (Level 1), Practical (Level 2), and Advanced (Level 3) sections. Record the primary H1 header for each file to facilitate mapping to the PRD outline.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create a preliminary list of files and verify that they cover PRD Sections 1 through 3 without gaps.

subtasks.title: Analyze Supplemental and Legacy Sources
subtasks.description: Review staging, legacy, and template directories to identify content updates, unique admin workflows, and exercises.
subtasks.details:
Parse `staging/refined_content.md` to identify specific sections that supersede core docs. Scan `legacy/` specifically for Admin workflows not present in `docs/`. Catalog `templates/exercises/` for inclusion in the Workbook/Appendix section.
<info added on 2025-11-22T14:39:27.028Z>
{
  "subtask_update": "Completed comparison of root vs legacy Admin guides and cataloged template files.

Analysis Findings:
1. Root `University_Copilot_Guide_Admin.md` contains duplicate Level 2 content (lines 171-237 duplicate 104-169). Legacy version is cleaner.
   - Resolution: Remove lines 171-237 from root file.
2. Template Mapping for Workbooks:
   - `email_draft_template.md` → Workbook 1 (Level 1)
   - `plan_2024.md` and `memo_2025.txt` → Workbook 2 (Level 2)
   - `meeting_note_template.txt` → Workbook 3 (Level 3)
3. Content Priority Established:
   - Primary: `University_Copilot_Guide_for_Beginners.md`
   - Secondary: `University_Copilot_Guide_Admin.md`
   - Reference: `legacy/University_Copilot_Guide_Admin.md`

Next: Update `content_map.json` with specific line numbers and embedding strategy."
}
</info added on 2025-11-22T14:39:27.028Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Produce a diff report listing which staging sections override docs and which legacy files are unique.

subtasks.title: Generate Content Map JSON Artifact
subtasks.description: Create the final `content_map.json` file defining the source-to-destination mapping for the document compilation.
subtasks.details: Construct a JSON object with keys for Introduction, Basics, Practical, Advanced, Admin, and Appendix. Populate values with source paths, enforcing the priority logic (Staging > Docs > Legacy) and output the file to the root directory.
subtasks.testStrategy: Validate `content_map.json` against a schema validator and ensure every PRD section key resolves to a valid existing file path.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Create a detailed mapping strategy. Subtasks: 1. Inventory existing `docs/` structure and map to PRD sections. 2. Analyze `staging/` and `legacy/` for unique content requiring integration. 3. Generate the final `content_map.json`.

tasks.title: English Content Consolidation (Drafting)
tasks.description: Create the final English documentation by translating the consolidated Korean guide, replacing the previous plan of merging empty English skeletons.
tasks.details:
1. Primary Source: `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md` (Output of Task 14), which consolidates the actual content from `University_Copilot_Guide_for_Beginners.md`.
2. Destination: Create `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_EN.md`.
3. Strategy: Perform a full translation of the Korean consolidated file into English. Do NOT use `docs/en/` files as they are confirmed to be empty navigation skeletons.
4. Structure: Preserve the exact Markdown hierarchy (H1-H3), image references, and code blocks from the Korean source.
5. Terminology: Ensure specific Copilot terms are localized correctly to standard English usage.
tasks.testStrategy: Verify `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_EN.md` exists. Perform a structural comparison against the Korean source (section counts, headers). Check for readability and correct rendering of code blocks and exercises.

subtasks.title: Prepare Translation Source
subtasks.description: Validate the consolidated Korean guide availability and structure before translation.
subtasks.details: Wait for Task 14 to generate `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md`. Verify the file is complete, UTF-8 encoded, and contains all expected sections (Intro, Basics, Practical, Advanced, Admin) derived from `University_Copilot_Guide_for_Beginners.md`. Confirm `docs/en/` skeletons are ignored.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check for the existence of the KO source file and pass basic integrity checks (size > 0, headers present).

subtasks.title: Execute English Translation
subtasks.description: Translate the consolidated Korean content into English.
subtasks.details: Translate text from `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md` to `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_EN.md`. Ensure that 'Prompt', 'Context Window', and other technical terms are used correctly. Preserve all Markdown syntax, including tables and code blocks, exactly as they appear in the source.
subtasks.testStrategy: Review a sample of the translated output to ensure text is English and formatting tags remain valid Markdown.

subtasks.title: Normalize and Validate Structure
subtasks.description: Ensure the translated document maintains the correct header hierarchy and formatting.
subtasks.details: Post-process the translated file. Verify that the Header levels (H1, H2, H3) align 1:1 with the Korean source. Fix any broken image links or malformed tables that may have occurred during the translation process.
subtasks.testStrategy: Use a Markdown linter to check for syntax errors. Visually compare the Table of Contents of the EN version against the KO version.

subtasks.title: Manual Review and Content Refinement
subtasks.description: Perform a human review of the generated draft to fix formatting glitches and awkward phrasing.
subtasks.details:
Review `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_EN.md`. Smooth out any awkward machine-translated phrasing. Ensure exercises from `templates/exercises/` (if referenced) are clear and actionable in English. Verify diagram descriptions are translated.
<info added on 2025-11-22T15:13:44.054Z>
{
  "subtask_update": "Manual review of `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_EN.md` completed.

Verified Sections:
- Introduction (Level 1): Professional tone, clear setup.
- Practical (Level 2): R.C.O formula and prompt techniques clear.
- Expert (Level 3): Agent instructions and data viz examples verified.
- Workbook & Appendix: Templates actionable, scenario library structured.
- Technical: Mermaid diagrams translated, Quizzes functional.

Fixed Issues:
- Line 597: Changed 'button this up' to 'get this started off right' (idiom correction).

Quality Assessment:
- Professional tone and consistent terminology (Copilot, VS Code) maintained.
- No awkward machine translation detected.
- Parallel structure with Korean version preserved.

Document ready for final commit."
}
</info added on 2025-11-22T15:13:44.054Z>
subtasks.testStrategy: Read through the guide as a user to ensure flow and clarity. Verify no Korean text remains in the body content.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Break down the consolidation process. Subtasks: 1. Develop a script to concatenate files based on `content_map.json`. 2. Implement logic to resolve content conflicts (staging vs docs). 3. Normalise markdown headers programmatically. 4. Manually review and refine the stitched document.

tasks.title: Korean Content Consolidation (Drafting)
tasks.description: Merge Korean content sources into a single Markdown file, ensuring parity with the English version.
tasks.details:
1. Create `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md`.
2. Follow the same structure as Task 13 but using `docs/ko/` sources.
3. For `staging/` or `legacy/` content that might lack KO translations, flag sections with a `[NEEDS TRANSLATION]` marker or use existing root-level KO files if available.
4. Ensure terminology consistency (e.g., 'Copilot', 'Prompt' usage).
tasks.testStrategy: Side-by-side comparison of EN and KO files to ensure section counts and header structures match exactly.

subtasks.title: Replicate English Consolidation Logic for Korean Sources
subtasks.description: Create the initial Korean draft by adapting the English consolidation script to target Korean source directories.
subtasks.details: Adapt the automation logic from Task 13 to read primarily from `docs/ko/`. Concatenate content in the PRD-defined order (Intro -> Levels 1-3 -> Admin -> Appendix) and output the result to `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md`. Ensure header normalization applies to the Korean text.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify that `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md` is created and contains the base content from `docs/ko/`.

subtasks.title: Perform Gap Analysis and Flag Missing Translations
subtasks.description: Compare the generated Korean structure against the English version to identify and mark missing content.
subtasks.details: Iterate through the sections defined in `content_map.json`. Where a corresponding Korean source file is missing (particularly in `staging/`), insert a placeholder section with the header and a body text of `[NEEDS TRANSLATION]` to maintain structural parity with the English file.
subtasks.testStrategy: Grep the output file for `[NEEDS TRANSLATION]` markers and verify they align with known missing source files compared to the EN version.

subtasks.title: Integrate Root-Level and Legacy Korean Files
subtasks.description: Incorporate existing Korean translations found in legacy or root directories into the main draft.
subtasks.details: Scan `legacy/` and the project root for specific Korean markdown files that cover Admin workflows or other outlying sections. Map these files to the corresponding gaps identified in the previous step and overwrite the `[NEEDS TRANSLATION]` placeholders with this content.
subtasks.testStrategy: Manual inspection of the Admin and Legacy sections in the generated Markdown file to ensure Korean text is present instead of placeholders.

subtasks.title: Enforce Korean Terminology Consistency
subtasks.description: Review and sanitize the consolidated Korean text to ensure consistent usage of key technical terms.
subtasks.details: Run a search-and-replace or validation script on `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md`. Ensure terms like 'Copilot' and 'Prompt' match the approved glossary (e.g., keeping 'Copilot' in English vs transliteration). specific focus on spacing between English and Korean characters.
subtasks.testStrategy: Search the final document for banned terminology variations and verify that key terms match the project glossary.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Plan the localization consolidation. Subtasks: 1. Replicate the English consolidation logic for Korean sources. 2. Identify and flag missing translations (gap analysis). 3. Integrate existing root-level KO files. 4. Perform terminology consistency check.

tasks.title: Visual Enhancement: Basics and Practical Levels
tasks.description: Create and embed Mermaid diagrams for Level 1 and Level 2 sections.
tasks.details:
1. Implement Mermaid code blocks for:
   - Setup Flow (Flowchart)
   - First Prompt Example (Sequence/Flow)
   - Prompt Engineering Cycle (Flowchart)
   - Document Generation Process (Sequence)
2. Insert these blocks into relevant sections in both EN and KO files.
3. Ensure labels in KO diagrams are translated to Korean.
tasks.testStrategy: Render the Markdown files in a Mermaid-compatible viewer (e.g., VS Code Preview) to verify diagrams render correctly without syntax errors.

subtasks.title: Design and Implement English Mermaid Diagrams
subtasks.description: Create the standard Mermaid diagram code for the four required workflows and embed them into the English documentation.
subtasks.details: Develop Mermaid syntax for: 1. Setup Flow (Flowchart), 2. First Prompt Example (Sequence/Flow), 3. Prompt Engineering Cycle (Flowchart), and 4. Document Generation Process (Sequence). Insert these code blocks into the appropriate sections of the Level 1 and Level 2 English Markdown files.
subtasks.testStrategy: Render the Markdown files in VS Code or a Mermaid Live Editor to verify syntax correctness and logical flow.

subtasks.title: Localize Diagrams for Korean Documentation
subtasks.description: Translate the diagram content into Korean and embed the localized versions into the Korean documentation files.
subtasks.details: Duplicate the approved English Mermaid blocks into the Korean Level 1 and Level 2 files. Translate all text labels within the diagrams (nodes, edges, notes) into natural Korean, ensuring terminology matches the surrounding text.
subtasks.testStrategy: Preview the generated diagrams to ensure Korean characters render correctly (no font issues) and translation context is accurate.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Detail the diagram creation. Subtasks: 1. Design and code Mermaid diagrams for English sections. 2. Duplicate and translate diagram labels for Korean sections.

tasks.title: Visual Enhancement: Advanced and Admin Levels
tasks.description: Create and embed Mermaid diagrams for Level 3 and Administrative Guide sections.
tasks.details:
1. Implement Mermaid code blocks for:
   - Agent Instruction Flow
   - Data Visualization Pipeline
   - Admin Task Workflow
   - Meeting Notes Processing
2. Insert into EN and KO files.
3. Ensure labels in KO diagrams are translated.
tasks.testStrategy: Render verification in VS Code or GitHub preview. Verify text labels are legible and correct in both languages.

subtasks.title: Design and Embed Advanced/Admin Mermaid Diagrams (English)
subtasks.description: Develop and insert Mermaid.js chart definitions for Level 3 and Administrative Guide sections in the English documentation.
subtasks.details:
Create diagrams for: Agent Instruction Flow, Data Visualization Pipeline, Admin Task Workflow, and Meeting Notes Processing. Use Flowchart and Sequence diagram types where appropriate. Insert these code blocks into the corresponding EN markdown files in the dist folder.
<info added on 2025-11-22T15:16:49.888Z>

subtasks.testStrategy: Render verification in VS Code Markdown Preview to check for syntax errors and visual clarity of the complex flows.

subtasks.title: Localize and Embed Advanced/Admin Mermaid Diagrams (Korean)
subtasks.description: Adapt the advanced diagrams for the Korean documentation by translating internal labels and text.
subtasks.details: Copy the Mermaid blocks generated for the English version into the Korean markdown files. Translate all readable text (node labels, decision points, descriptions) into Korean while maintaining the original logic structure. Ensure layout remains stable with Korean text width.
subtasks.testStrategy: Check Korean character rendering in a standard browser preview or GitHub to ensure no encoding issues exist.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Detail the advanced diagram creation. Subtasks: 1. Design Mermaid workflows for complex Admin/Advanced processes. 2. Localize diagrams for the Korean version.

tasks.title: Administrative Guide Section Refinement
tasks.description: Refine the specific 'Administrative Guide' section to ensure it addresses university staff workflows clearly.
tasks.details:
1. Review the 'Administrative Guide' section in `dist/` files.
2. Rewrite technical jargon to be user-friendly for non-technical staff.
3. Ensure specific workflows (Email drafting, Annual reports, Meeting minutes) are clearly step-by-step.
4. Incorporate 'Good vs Bad' prompt examples specifically for admin tasks.
tasks.testStrategy: Read-through by a proxy for a non-technical user. Verify that instructions are actionable and free of unexplained technical terms.

subtasks.title: Audit Administrative Guide for Jargon
subtasks.description: Review the existing 'Administrative Guide' section within the `dist/` files to identify and replace technical terminology with plain English.
subtasks.details: Scan the current documentation for technical terms (e.g., 'tokens', 'inference', 'JSON output') that may confuse university staff. Create a mapping of these terms to user-friendly alternatives or rewrite sentences to avoid them entirely while maintaining accuracy.
subtasks.testStrategy: Peer review by a non-technical team member to flag any remaining confusing terms.

subtasks.title: Draft Administrative Prompt Examples
subtasks.description: Create a set of 'Good vs Bad' prompt examples specifically tailored to university administrative scenarios.
subtasks.details: Develop specific comparison examples for key tasks: 1. Drafting a department-wide email, 2. Summarizing meeting minutes, and 3. Compiling annual report data. Clearly annotate why the 'Good' version is better (e.g., specificity, context provision).
subtasks.testStrategy: Run the 'Good' and 'Bad' prompts through the model to verify that the output difference justifies the example.

subtasks.title: Rewrite Workflow Instructions
subtasks.description: Reconstruct the specific workflow sections into clear, step-by-step guides using the refined language and examples.
subtasks.details: Refactor the sections for 'Email Drafting', 'Annual Reports', and 'Meeting Minutes'. Ensure each workflow uses a numbered list format. Integrate the 'Good vs Bad' examples drafted in the previous subtask directly into these workflow descriptions to illustrate best practices.
subtasks.testStrategy: Perform a manual walk-through of the 'Meeting Minutes' workflow to ensure instructions are logical and complete without external knowledge.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Outline the refinement process. Subtasks: 1. Audit current Admin content for technical jargon. 2. Draft 'Good vs Bad' prompt examples for admin scenarios. 3. Rewrite workflow instructions for clarity.

tasks.title: Formatting, Navigation, and TOC Generation
tasks.description: Finalize document formatting and generate a clickable Table of Contents.
tasks.details:
1. Add a 'Table of Contents' section after the Title Page.
2. Generate internal Markdown links (anchors) for all H2 and H3 headers.
3. Ensure all image references point to `dist/images/` (relative paths).
4. Standardize fonts/spacing if using HTML tags, otherwise rely on standard Markdown.
5. Add Version History section at the end.
tasks.testStrategy: Click every link in the TOC to ensure it jumps to the correct section. Check that no broken image links exist.

subtasks.title: Generate Table of Contents for English Guide
subtasks.description: Inject a clickable Table of Contents into the English consolidated guide.
subtasks.details: Locate `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_EN.md`. Find the placeholder or the position immediately after the Title Page. detailed in Task 13. Parse all H1, H2, and H3 headers. Generate a standard Markdown list with internal anchor links (e.g., `[Section Title](#section-title-slug)`) and insert it into the document.
subtasks.testStrategy: Open the Markdown file in a viewer (e.g., VS Code Preview or GitHub) and verify that clicking TOC entries scrolls to the correct section.

subtasks.title: Generate Table of Contents for Korean Guide
subtasks.description: Inject a clickable Table of Contents into the Korean consolidated guide.
subtasks.details: Locate `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md`. Similar to the English version, parse H1, H2, and H3 headers. Ensure that the slug generation handles Korean characters correctly (URL encoding or standard Markdown anchor behavior for non-ASCII text) so links remain clickable.
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify in a Markdown viewer that TOC links containing Korean characters correctly navigate to their respective headers.

subtasks.title: Update and Validate Image References
subtasks.description: Standardize all image paths to point to the distribution image directory.
subtasks.details: Scan both `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_EN.md` and `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md`. Regex replace existing image paths (e.g., `../images/`, `assets/`) to use the relative path `./images/` or `images/` assuming the Markdown files sit in `dist/` and images are in `dist/images/`. Ensure localized images in the KO version point to `images/ko/` if applicable.
subtasks.testStrategy: Render the Markdown files and visually confirm all images load. Check specifically for broken link icons.

subtasks.title: Standardize Formatting and Styles
subtasks.description: Apply consistent spacing and remove unnecessary HTML tags.
subtasks.details: Review both consolidated files. Remove inline HTML styles (like `<span style=...>`) unless strictly necessary for complex tables. Standardize list indentation (2 or 4 spaces) and ensure there is a blank line before and after code blocks. Ensure headers are preceded by two blank lines for readability.
subtasks.testStrategy: Lint the Markdown files using a tool like markdownlint or manually check visual consistency in a previewer.

subtasks.title: Append Version History Section
subtasks.description: Add a standardized Version History section to the end of both documents.
subtasks.details: At the bottom of both EN and KO consolidated files, append an H2 header 'Version History' (or '버전 기록'). Create a table with columns: Version, Date, Author, and Change Log. Populate the initial row with the current version details (e.g., v1.0, current date, 'Initial Consolidated Release').
subtasks.testStrategy: Verify the section exists at the very end of the document and the table renders correctly.

tasks.title: Localization QA and Parity Verification
tasks.description: Perform a final quality assurance check to ensure English and Korean versions are synchronized.
tasks.details:
1. Verify that every section in EN has a corresponding section in KO.
2. Check that all diagrams in KO have Korean labels.
3. Verify that file names and folder structures in examples are appropriate for the language context.
4. Ensure `dist/images/ko/` contains all necessary localized assets.
tasks.testStrategy: Manual audit checklist comparing section-by-section. Verify total line counts are roughly proportional (accounting for language density).

subtasks.title: Section-by-Section Structural Audit (EN vs KO)
subtasks.description: Perform a detailed structural comparison between the consolidated English and Korean Markdown files to ensure complete synchronization of content hierarchy.
subtasks.details:
1. Open `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_EN.md` and `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md` side-by-side.
2. Verify that every H1, H2, and H3 header in the English version has a corresponding translated header in the Korean version.
3. Check that the sequence of sections is identical.
4. Ensure that code blocks and examples are present in corresponding locations.
5. Document any missing sections or structural mismatches.
subtasks.testStrategy: Create a header inventory list from the English document and check off each item against the Korean document. Discrepancies must be zero.

subtasks.title: Visual Asset and Path Localization Verification
subtasks.description: Audit the inclusion, referencing, and content of localized images and diagrams within the Korean documentation.
subtasks.details:
1. Verify that the `dist/images/ko/` directory contains localized versions of all diagrams that contain text.
2. specific check: Ensure diagrams in KO have Korean labels replacing English text.
3. Scan `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md` to confirm that image references point to `images/ko/` where necessary, rather than the English assets.
4. Verify that file names and folder paths in code examples are localized or appropriate for the Korean context.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run a grep search for image links in the Korean MD file to verify paths. Visually inspect all images in `dist/images/ko/` for correct text translation.

tasks.expansionPrompt: Structure the QA process. Subtasks: 1. Conduct a section-by-section structural audit (EN vs KO). 2. Verify asset localization (images/diagrams).

tasks.title: Project Cleanup and Final Delivery
tasks.description: Remove obsolete source directories and verify the final distribution package.
tasks.details:
1. Verify `archive/` contains all original data (Safety Check).
2. Delete `docs/`, `legacy/`, `staging/`, and `templates/` folders.
3. Delete root-level markdown files (`University_Copilot_Guide_for_Beginners.md`, etc.).
4. Ensure project root only contains `dist/`, `archive/`, `README.md`, and config files.
5. Update root `README.md` to point to the new files in `dist/`.
tasks.testStrategy: Run `ls -R` to verify directory structure. Ensure no source files remain in root. Verify `dist/` files still open and render correctly after cleanup.

subtasks.title: Verify Archive Integrity
subtasks.description: Perform a safety check to ensure the archive directory contains a complete backup of all source materials before deletion.
subtasks.details: Compare the contents of `docs/`, `legacy/`, `staging/`, and `templates/` against the existing contents of `archive/`. If any files are missing in `archive/`, copy them over to a timestamped subfolder within `archive/` (e.g., `archive/pre_cleanup_backup/`) to prevent data loss.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run a script or command (diff -r or similar) to verify that all files in source directories exist within the archive path.

subtasks.title: Remove Obsolete Source Directories
subtasks.description: Delete the source directories that have been consolidated into the final distribution.
subtasks.details: Execute removal commands for `docs/`, `legacy/`, `staging/`, and `templates/`. Ensure that no processes have these files open. This step should only proceed after the archive integrity check (Subtask 1) passes successfully.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run `ls -d docs/ legacy/ staging/ templates/` and verify that the command returns 'No such file or directory' for all listed paths.

subtasks.title: Remove Redundant Root Files
subtasks.description: Clean up root-level markdown files that are now redundant or obsolete.
subtasks.details: Identify and delete specific root-level files such as `University_Copilot_Guide_for_Beginners.md` and `University_Copilot_Guide_Advanced.md`. Ensure that `README.md` is NOT deleted during this process. Only files explicitly identified as obsolete source content should be removed.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run `ls *.md` in the root directory. The output should ideally only list `README.md` (and potentially `CONTRIBUTING.md` or `LICENSE` if they exist).

subtasks.title: Update Root README
subtasks.description: Update the main project README to reflect the new structure and point to the final distribution files.
subtasks.details: Edit `README.md` to remove references to the deleted source folders. Add clear links to the final artifacts in `dist/` (e.g., `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_EN.md` and `dist/University_Copilot_Guide_Complete_KO.md`). Add a note explaining the `archive/` directory structure.
subtasks.testStrategy: Manually review `README.md` rendering. Click the links to `dist/` files to verify they are valid and accessible.

subtasks.title: Final Distribution Verification
subtasks.description: Validate the final state of the project root and the integrity of the distribution folder.
subtasks.details: Perform a final audit of the directory structure. The root should only contain `dist/`, `archive/`, `README.md`, and project configuration files (like `.gitignore`, `package.json`). Verify that the files in `dist/` are the complete, consolidated versions generated in previous tasks.
subtasks.testStrategy: Run `tree -L 1` (or equivalent) to confirm directory hierarchy. Open the markdown files in `dist/` to ensure they are not corrupted.
